author: w.illiam
title: Cardano Swapping Application
description: The current method of exchanging native assets and NFTs relies on payment in the base currency ADA. We propose a solution that allows direct swaps of NFTs and tokens for other NFTs and tokens.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal offers an interesting scenario to execute a trade of NFTs or swap of NFTs/Native assets without incurring charges in ADA. The verbatim explanation from the proposal is “A link would be provided to the proposer to be sent to the potential acceptor of the trade. After the trade is accepted, both parties would be prompted to send the agreed-upon items to a temporary wallet until all agreed-upon native assets are collected from both parties. Once all agreed-upon assets are received, both parties will receive their agreed-upon items. In the event that one or both parties fail to send the agreed upon assets within a given time limit, the smart contract will revert and return any assets it has received to the proper wallets.”. I doubt if any smart contact would execute without a transaction fee and the requirement of minimum ADA for any transaction. If this is not the aim of the proposal then I feel similar sites to swap NFTs/Native assets exit in the ecosystem and have been funded even in the catalyst.  Therefore there is a need for more clarity and explanation on how this smart contract will be different from the other, or will the application will be a pseudo-centralised one.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is from William H, who is a Software Engineering Student and Bryant V - Cyber Security Student from Embry Riddle Aeronautical University. First of all, it is heartening to see Young minds interested in the Cardano ecosystem. We had the first successful NFT project launched in Cardano by innovative use of Mary hard fork by Alexander. Therefore there is a very high chance the proposing pair will be able to deliver the proposal successfully. However, any reference to any of their past work would have brought more confidence in their proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have appreciated 160 hours for UI development and 120 hours for smart contract development with 40 hours of testing. These are reasonable times. The developer's compensation is fixed at $50 USD per hour which has been the rate quoted by all US-based proposals. The project is expected to be delivered in four months. There is no mention of the written code is open source. It can be seen that the proposers are planning to host and operate the site since they have included website registration and operation cost. Less the concerns regarding the feasibility of executing transactions in Cardano without using ADA, the proposal is a fairly straightforward dApp application. However, the concern is fundamental and has the potential to alter the appreciation of the proposal. Therefore the output is not clear at this instance and the exact value addition is not very apparent.

f6_assessments.q0: I do think the idea being proposed addresses the challenge. NFTs are growing in popularity on Cardano, and providing an NFT swapping centric project would enrich the Cardano dAPP experience. I am not currently aware of any direct NFT to NFT swapping projects on Cardano at this time. However, I feel that not enough information is presented in this proposal as to how it will be implemented, or what type of experience the user would have. For example, will there be a fee on top of the network fee, collected by the proposer? Will the swapping mechanism be built with Marlow or with Plutus? Will there be any dispute resolution service? So yes, the idea meets the challenge setting, but the proposal needs some additional details.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a student and doesn't explain how his or her team experience relates to smart contract writing on Cardano. The proposer should demonstrate to what level of experience they have in full stack developing. I would recommend they provide links to projects they have built in school or in their spare time, or at least talk to their experience in whatever stack they are leaning. Object-oriented programming skills do not directly translate to functional programming, and if they are going to write the contract in Plutus, users need to feel that their assets are safe. Marlow is a domain specific language using Plutus that is designed to be dummy proof, and this project sounds like a perfect use case. However, Marlowe is not on main net yet. The simple swap approach they are taking should be fairly easy to write, but because the proposer isn't illuminating their level of experience and convincing the voters that they can complete the task, I am rating it two starts.
f6_assessments.q2: Not enough is presented to suggest the project would be easy to audit. The proposer should provide links to a GitHub repository where anyone can go see the code base. They should also hire a third party to audit the code base and make the audit results publically available. In addition, the proposer should make as many updates and announcements using multiple social media platforms. Unfortunately, the proposer doesn't specify and only mentions using social media. The project should first be built on the test net, and the proposer should invite the community to test the product with them.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of an exchange of native assets between two people without the existence of third parties is actually a good one, that could save resources, time and money. I see how this could have a good impact on the ecosystem, as the problem stated as well as the described solution for the problem are clearly described. The proposal effectively addresses the challenge as it is a new product on the smart contract development field and it could be a motive to address aslo future challanges. It is useful that the smart contract that is going to be implemented, is described in detail with all its variables.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a plan with a timeline there and seems quite realistiv from my point of view. The budget is also described clearly and has been broken down into indentifiable items. However, i am inclined to believe that considering a smaller budget, maybe on the next funding round, would give you more possibilities to get funded indeed. That doesn't necessarily mean that you are asking for much but may you take that into consideration for future proposals. It is very important to provide the skills and the relevant experience of the team members, as the voters need to verify that this proposal can success. I understand that being a student, doesn't leave much space to build up experience, but that is something that should be mentioned. Something else that should be mentioned, is the necessary resources needed as well as the architecture and language that is going to be used, for exaple is the smart contract going to be written in Plutus? I also don't find the description of the possible risks explanatory enough, so may you be less brief on a next proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap with milestones in it and that is something useful but there are no key metrics nor they are quantified, as they are not existent. Consider mentioning things such how many exchanges will be needed to be executed to consider this proposal as a success? How many people should get engaged to those exchanges or even how many native assets etc will be exhanged? Ι can see how the progress of the proposal is going to be tracked with the upcoming roadmap. Maybe consider proving weekly reports as there will be weekly gatherings to discuss the updates.

f6_assessments.q0:
The issue being payment in the base currency ADA is the current method of exchanging native assets and NFTs. The proposer wants to resolve it by allowing NFTs and tokens to be swapped directly for other NFTs and tokens.
The solution being enable two interested parties to propose a trade of NFTs and tokens in exchange for other native assets. The transaction will take place if both parties agree on the trade. This will add value to cardano ecosystem. therefore this proposal effectively addresses the issue
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has the required skills and experience to implement the proposal based on the details provided in the proposal. The proposal consist of clear plan to implement and also provided budget breakdown. Based on the budget breakdown the fund requested is reasonable. The proposer has mentioned that there isn't any foreseeable risk that may effect the implementation of the proposal. It is very likely the proposal will be carried out successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal consist of clear plan with milestone and a timeline. The proposer has mentioned that they will provide a detailed roadmap upon funding and also updates will be provided via social media. This will be helpful for auditors to audit the the progress of the proposal. The success of the proposal will allow two user who do not know each other can trade without the NFT marketplaces and DEX's. If this project succeeds, Cardano users will have a new way to buy and sell native assets without having to use the base currency ADA. Given info should be enough to track the development and success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: The "Cardano swapping application" proposal addresses the Dapps, Products & Integration challenge by building an interface to trade between parties, connect their wallets and enter the receiving address of counterparty. It allows the transaction in the peer to peer, trustless and not using DEX or marketplaces or ADA. The team has not defined any foreseeable challenges in delivering the project. The proposal doesn't detail technically how this could be done. Neither did they raise the example of this peer to peer exchange or swap that already exist elsewhere and its success in term of traction. The information provided by this proposal is not sufficient to determine the impact towards the challenge which aims to increase impactful dApps within Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The delivery of project in 4 months look reasonable should it be possible technically to do this. Based on the comments, the team is comprised of 2 college students with experience in C, C++, Python, Solidity and Java Script. It should be possible for them to learn Haskell and get up to the speed of project. The proposal has detailed the development cost along with the pay rate and number of hours involved in each task. The team members should provide their GitHub or LinkedIn profile to add to the feasibility of this project. These information will be important for their proposals in future round also as they plan to return to Catalyst if their swap feature gain traction. The team hasn't mentioned any risk and ways to mitigate the risk. Neither did the team provide team's past project or technical ability to handle the tasks, this leaves a few questions on their project's feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The team defines project's success as the trade that would occur between 2 individuals without NFT marketplaces or DEX. The proposed solution will be a swap of native assets without base currency ADA. The team has not provided a detailed roadmap yet; hence, the KPIs or metrics are not clear except that it is a delivery of their monthly tasks. Although the team has identified the issue of reliance on ADA for the exchange of native assets and NFTs, the team has not provided clear enough technical detail of solution let alone more detail of the project. The team should not wait to supply detailed roadmap upon funding as they said but rather provide information now in this proposal submission stage. The updates will be provided to the community via social media with their weekly team discussion. The team would need to supply roadmap information in order to boost transparency and auditability of their proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I consider this project's impact to be low and bring little value to Catalyst and the Cardano ecosystem. The content of the proposal is to build a solution that allows swapping NFTs and tokens to other native assets, and the exchange will be done outside of the DEX exchanges on Carado as well as outside the NFT market. This is completely against the values that this challenge wants to create and expect the proposals in the challenge to make sense for the Cardano ecosystem. The ADA native coin is not used in the transaction which means that nothing of value is created on-chain. Therefore, the proposal does not effectively address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
I think the feasibility of the project is just average. When we first look at the project's implementation roadmap, we all see that the project focuses on building infrastructure such as websites, smart contracts, and testing. We have two students who will take on this construction role. This is great when building the platform but besides developing the platform another important factor that needs to be done is  marketing. Good marketing will bring the project to more users, creating a buzz for the project. However, the marketing phase has not been mentioned in the roadmap yet. I have advice for the project to develop a marketing implementation plan as well as add more members to take on this role.
Second, risks and challenges have not been mentioned. I very much welcome the team's fighting spirit and will to not give up on any challenge, but being prepared for possible risks and challenges will help us to have more confidence, prepare to execute the project in the most successful way. Therefore, I suggest that all issues that may hinder the implementation of this project should be evaluated.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the proposal is not convincing to me. It is proposed to provide me the members who will be responsible for implementing this project but have not provided relevant evidence, evidence that helps the community to verify who they are, evidence of their experience be like. That is, provide more personal profiles of each member. In addition, the measurement of project progress is, in my opinion, incomplete. The team has not provided concrete evidence to track progress. For example, provide specific social networking sites that will be used to update project news (maybe Twitter, Telegram, Facebook ) In addition, there are no numbers to assess the exact level of a successful project, KPI performance. For example, after 6 months, the number of users using the solution is 100 people, the number of transactions made is 50 transactions. These suggestions are considered to be the factors that help convince the community that the project we build is successful and is the right target.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposed solution effectively addresses the problem of the current complexity of swapping NFT on the Cardano Blockchain. The proposer has thought through a good solution on how to directly trade NFTs with untrusting parties.
The proposers could have explained the implementation of the temporary wallet more clearly. In particular how scalable it is use a temporary wallet.
The proposers could have also explained the exact time limit that the smart contract would revert the transaction.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is likely to be implemented as the proposes seems to be capable and knowledge around the implementation.
The budget breakdown is good. It could have broken down the hourly pay for all the components given.
The plan seems to be solid but could have included details about delivery, and Swapping smart contracts design & implementation sections
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided I’d somewhat sufficient to audit the process. The proposers could have elaborated more on key milestones in the project linked to the budget breakdown. This would make the work of the auditor easier and simpler

solution: The proposed solution would allow 2 interested parties to propose a trade of NFTs and tokens for other native assets. If the trade is agreed upon by both parties, the transaction will execute.
experience: Software Engineering students from Embry Riddle Aeronautical University
